Bienvenido a laurbeframework

Hay partes de codigo imperativo que deberian extraerse a una clase de utilidad, por ejemplo en BankServiceUseCase.java encontramos estos bloques en las implementaciones de los metodos:     if (satClosures != null ){       satClosures.removeIf( sC -> sC.getId().equals(idSatClosure));       var calendarUtils = new CalendarUtils();       calendarUtils.addPeriods(satClosures ); //existing ones       calendarUtils.addPeriod(startDate, endDate ); // the one to be modified       calendarUtils.verifyOverlaps(); // Will throw an exception if there is overlap     } Deberia sacarse a una clase externa y hacer el codigo mas declarativo.   @Override   public void updateBankSaturdayClosure(Long idSatClosure, Boolean deposits, Date startDate, Date endDate) {     BankSaturdayClosure satClosure = bankRepositoryAdapter.findBankSaturdayClosure(idSatClosure);     //Obtaining existing periods to control overlappings     Collection satClosures = bankRepositoryAdapter.findBankSaturdayClosuresByBank(satClosure.getBank().getBankCode());     //Validation of filtering     SatValidator.validateOverlaps(satClosures);     bankRepositoryAdapter.updateBankSaturdayClosure(idSatClosure, deposits, startDate, endDate);   } https://khalilstemmler.com/articles/typescript-domain-driven-design/ddd-vs-crud-design/
